intro: Antirrhinum majus var. hybridum, commonly known as the common snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in a wide range of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. The flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological significance.
